# rulerView(_:didAdd:)

**Instance Method**

Modifies the paragraph style of the paragraphs containing the selection to accommodate a new marker.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor func rulerView(_ ruler: NSRulerView, didAdd marker: NSRulerMarker)
```

## Parameters

- **ruler**: The ruler view sending the message.
- **marker**: The marker that was added.

## Discussion

This method records the change by invoking [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSTextView/didChangeText()] after adding the marker.

`NSTextView` checks for permission to make the change in its [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSTextView/rulerView(_:shouldAdd:)] method, which invokes [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSTextView/shouldChangeText(in:replacementString:)] to send out the proper request and notifications, and only invokes this method if permission is granted.

## Related Documentation

- **representedObject**: The object the receiver represents.

## Supporting the ruler view

- **rulerView(_:didMove:)**: Modifies the paragraph style of the paragraphs containing the selection to record the new location of the marker.
- **rulerView(_:willMove:toLocation:)**: Returns a potentially modified location to which the marker should be moved.
- **rulerView(_:shouldMove:)**: Returns whether the marker should be moved.
- **rulerView(_:didRemove:)**: Modifies the paragraph style of the paragraphs containing the selection—if possible—by removing the specified marker.
- **rulerView(_:shouldRemove:)**: Returns whether the marker should be removed.
- **rulerView(_:shouldAdd:)**: Returns whether a new marker can be added.
- **rulerView(_:willAdd:atLocation:)**: Returns a potentially modified location to which the marker should be added.
- **rulerView(_:handleMouseDownWith:)**: Adds a left tab marker to the ruler at the location clicked.
